title: TUI: Show idle/active status indicators
description:
Context: The TUI should reflect session idle vs active state for quick triage.
Scope:
- Consume idle-state gRPC events in the TUI client.
- Display a color/icon indicator in the session list/status bar for active vs idle sessions.
- Ensure indicator updates live without disrupting navigation or rendering.
Acceptance:
- TUI shows a clear idle/active indicator per session.
- Indicators update promptly as idle state changes.
- No regressions to input handling or session navigation.

title: Attach mouse capture + coordinate mapping
description:
Capture mouse input in attach and map to viewport coordinates.

Scope:
- Use Bubbletea mouse options (WithMouseCellMotion or AllMotion).
- Ignore mouse while list/create modals are open.
- Convert terminal coords to session grid coords.

title: Web UI: Redesign multi-view command hierarchy to reduce clutter
description:
Context: The multi-view command area is cluttered. The filter controls and broadcast-to-selection are split across separate boxes, and the hierarchy feels disorganized.

Goal: Create a cohesive command hierarchy that surfaces the most-used actions and tucks lower-frequency actions behind menus to reduce visual clutter.

Scope:
- Inventory multi-view commands (filtering, selection, broadcast, etc.) and estimate usage frequency.
- Propose a unified command bar layout that prioritizes primary actions and hides secondary actions behind menus/overflow.
- Define interaction patterns for hidden commands (menu, kebab, etc.) and ensure accessibility.
- Update the UI layout to match the new hierarchy.

Acceptance:
- Multi-view controls feel cohesive and uncluttered.
- Primary actions are immediately visible; secondary actions are discoverable but not dominant.
- Usability is preserved on mobile and desktop.
- No regression to existing multi-view functionality.

title: Web UI: Show idle/active status indicators
description:
Context: Web UI needs at-a-glance visibility into session activity/idle state using the new idle-state stream.
Scope:
- Consume idle-state events via the web bridge and attach them to session entries.
- Add a color-based icon indicator for active vs idle (and optional unknown state).
- Ensure the indicator updates live and remains visible in session list (and multi-view thumbnails if present).
Acceptance:
- Session list shows a clear color/icon indicator for active vs idle.
- Indicators update within a short interval after idle-state changes.
- UI remains usable and accessible; no regressions to selection/attach.

title: Terminal renderer (keyframe-only)
description:
Implement terminal grid renderer from ScreenUpdate keyframes (no ANSI parsing).

Scope:
- Render ScreenRow/ScreenCell data with fg/bg/attributes.
- Handle cursor display and resize flow.
- Use run-based rendering to avoid per-cell DOM churn.

title: M0 - Project Setup
description:
Goal: Establish repo scaffolding and build/test workflow.

Deliverables:
- go.mod/go.sum with baseline deps
- proto/vtr.proto initial service/messages
- mise.toml tasks for proto/build/test
- cmd/vtr skeleton
- docs/progress.md referenced by docs/agent-meta.md

Success criteria:
- go test ./... passes
- mise run proto generates Go stubs locally
- repo layout matches docs/spec.md

Historical: completed 2026-01-18; migrated from docs/progress.md.

title: Web UI Favicon
description:
Goal: Provide a cohesive favicon + app icon set for the web UI.

Scope:
- Design or source a base mark/logo usable at small sizes.
- Generate favicon assets (ICO + PNG variants) and optional touch icons.
- Wire icons into the web app head metadata.
- Document the source file(s) and export pipeline.

Success criteria:
- Browser tabs show the new favicon.
- Icons look crisp at common sizes (16/32/48/180).
- Assets and source are tracked in repo with clear instructions for updates.

title: Web UI: Broadcast commands to selected sessions
description:
Context: The multi-view dashboard should act as a central command panel that can issue actions to selected sessions.
Scope:
- Add selection mechanics for multi-view thumbnails (single/multi-select).
- Provide a "send command" affordance that can broadcast keystrokes or control sequences to the selected sessions.
- Include guardrails (confirmations or preview) to prevent accidental broad sends.
Acceptance:
- Users can select multiple sessions from the multi-view dashboard.
- Sending a command/sequence broadcasts to all selected sessions.
- UI makes it clear which sessions will receive the command and offers a safety confirmation.

title: CGO sanitizer test target
description:
Add CGO sanitizer test target for go-ghostty and server VT integration.

Scope:
- go test -asan -tags=asan with cgocheck2 enabled.
- Use ASAN_OPTIONS/LSAN_OPTIONS with suppression files.
- Keep runtime under 5 minutes.

title: README: Add hero image + human-friendly overview
description:
Context: The top-level README needs a compelling hero image and human-focused narrative to explain the projectâ€™s novelty and rationale.
Scope:
- Create a hero image for README.md using the nanobanana skill/workflow (track source/prompts).
- Update README.md with a polished, human-friendly overview in the style of popular OSS projects (e.g., clawdbot/clawdbot, mcp_agent_mail).
- Include a concise hook, project rationale, key features, and quickstart/usage highlights.
- Ensure assets are stored in repo with clear attribution or generation notes.
Acceptance:
- README.md includes a hero image at the top and reads well for humans.
- The README has a clear hook + rationale + feature/usage sections.
- Image asset and generation notes are tracked in-repo.

title: Web UI: Rename session from tab context menu
description:
Context: Session tabs need a way to rename sessions without leaving the tab bar.
Scope:
- Add a "Rename" action to the tab right-click context menu.
- Provide an inline or lightweight rename UI (no heavy modal) and validate naming rules.
- Persist the updated name via the coordinator API and refresh the tab label.
Acceptance:
- Right-clicking a tab offers a Rename option.
- Renaming updates the session name in the UI and backend.
- Errors/collisions are handled gracefully.

title: TUI: Tab bar UX improvements
description:
Context: The attach TUI tab bar currently renders sessions and supports keyboard navigation. Improve usability, overflow handling, and visual affordances without breaking keyboard flows.

Scope:
- Maintain active tab visibility in all width-constrained layouts.
- Add overflow indicators that show how many tabs are hidden on each side when truncated.
- Provide clearer active/idle/exited styling in the tab bar (icons + text treatment).
- Improve name truncation behavior (consistent ellipsis + tooltip/alt behavior if feasible).
- Support mouse interactions when enabled: left-click switch, middle-click kill with confirmation if applicable.
- Allow horizontal tab scrolling (mouse wheel or key) to reveal hidden tabs when overflowed.
- Keep tab rendering aligned with header overlay padding and viewport width.
- Ensure tabs remain usable alongside list/create modals (no mouse bleed-through).

Acceptance:
- Active tab is always visible; overflow indicators are present when tabs are hidden.
- Clicking a tab switches sessions; middle-clicking kills the session (with confirmation if required).
- Overflow indicators are non-interactive and do not trigger session switches.
- Session state is visible in the tab bar and consistent with list view.
- No regressions to existing keyboard navigation or attach flow.

Dependencies:
- vtr-12j (Attach mouse capture + coordinate mapping)
- vtr-4vi (M8 - Attach TUI Mouse Support)

Notes:
- Coordinate with vtr-2wy for clickable tab behavior.

title: Subscribe keyframe semantics + gating
description:
Implement Subscribe semantics for keyframes and include_screen_updates gating.

Scope:
- Server sends initial keyframe only when include_screen_updates is true.
- Include frame_id/base_frame_id/is_keyframe in ScreenUpdate.
- Send final keyframe before session_exited.
- Maintain INVALID_ARGUMENT when no stream types requested.

Files: server/grpc.go, server/output.go (or current Subscribe implementation).

title: Tokyo Night UI spec + responsive layout
description:
Implement Tokyo Night UI spec with responsive mobile-first layout.

Scope:
- CSS variables per docs/spec.md (Tokyo Night palette).
- 44px touch targets, consistent spacing, typography.
- Avoid layout jumps on font load.

title: Web UI: Chrome-style tab bar styling and seamless terminal transition
description:
Context: The tab bar should visually match a Chrome-style tab strip, with a seamless transition into the terminal content.
Scope:
- Style the tab bar to resemble Chrome tabs (rounded corners, layered background, tab shapes).
- Remove vertical spacing between the tab bar and the terminal window (flush edge).
- Add a subtle background and rounded-corner transition between the tab bar and terminal panel.
Acceptance:
- Tab bar is visually flush with the terminal window (no vertical gap).
- Tabs and bar styling read as Chrome-like (rounded edges, layered background).
- The transition between tab bar and terminal panel feels cohesive and polished.

title: M6.5 - TUI Streaming Updates
description:
Goal: Align TUI streaming behavior with the unified streaming design.

Context:
- See docs/streaming.md and streaming sections in docs/spec.md.
- This milestone introduces frame_id/base_frame_id/is_keyframe + deltas.

Success criteria:
- TUI renders correctly with keyframes and resync handling
- Latest-only behavior under backpressure
- Subscribe semantics match docs/streaming.md and WS bridge behavior

title: Web UI: Add bottom padding/safe area to layout
description:
Context: App layout in web/src/App.tsx uses full-height sections; on mobile the ActionTray/InputBar can sit flush with the viewport bottom.
Scope:
- Add bottom padding/safe-area inset for the main layout and/or terminal section so UI elements do not touch the bottom edge.
- Keep spacing consistent on desktop and mobile.
Acceptance:
- No component intersects the bottom edge on common viewport sizes.
- iOS safe-area inset is respected (home indicator not overlapping UI).

title: M3 - gRPC Server Core
description:
Goal: Expose core session management and screen/input operations over gRPC.

Deliverables:
- gRPC server on Unix socket with Spawn/List/Info/Kill/Remove
- GetScreen/SendText/SendKey/SendBytes/Resize RPCs
- cmd/vtr serve
- gRPC integration tests with PTY-backed session

Success criteria:
- vtr serve works via Unix socket
- RPCs return correct state + error codes
- Tests validate screen after SendText + resize

title: Align WS server behavior with docs
description:
Align WS server behavior with docs.

- Update docs/spec.md or server code to match reality.

title: Web UI: Clip terminal row overflow
Mouse mode tracking (shim + Subscribe)
description:
Expose mouse mode via Ghostty shim and broadcast changes on Subscribe.

title: Begin Mouse Work
description: Gate to start mouse work. Keep mouse-related tasks blocked until this is closed. Close this issue to unblock the M8 mouse tasks.

title: Fix Coordinator Close method name conflict
Federation: Draft hub-and-spoke architecture proposal
description:
Context: The hub-and-spoke coordinator federation needs an initial architectural proposal before implementation.

- Enumerate at least 2 alternative architectures and tradeoffs.

- Keep doc scoped to coordinator federation + Tailscale transport integration.
Acceptance:

- Proposal aligns with the federation epic goals and constraints (hub serving web UI, optional UDS).

title: Web UI: Auto-scale terminal font to fit columns
description:
Context: Web terminal text size is fixed, so column alignment and readability suffer across varying viewport widths.
Scope:
- Dynamically scale terminal font size to fit the available column width in the browser.
- Scale up/down smoothly as the viewport resizes, without jitter.
- Preserve correct cell sizing and cursor alignment during scaling.
Acceptance:
- Terminal text scales to match the number of columns in the viewport without horizontal clipping.
- Resizing the browser smoothly adjusts font size in both directions.
- Cell alignment/cursor rendering remain accurate while scaling.

title: M1 - Ghostty Shim + Go Wrapper
description:
Goal: Prove VT engine integration and snapshot/dump access via go-ghostty.

Deliverables:
- go-ghostty/shim builds libvtr-ghostty-vt.a + header
- vtr_ghostty_* API per go-ghostty/README.md
- Go wrapper Terminal/Snapshot/Dump APIs
- Tests feeding ANSI and asserting snapshot/dump

Success criteria:

- Snapshot/cursor correctness validated

title: Web UI: Sort session tree with exited sessions last
description:
Context: Session tree mixes running and exited sessions, making active sessions harder to find.
Scope:
- Reorder sessions within each coordinator so running sessions appear first and exited sessions appear last.
- Preserve existing coordinator grouping and any other ordering within each status group.
Acceptance:
- Each coordinator lists running sessions before exited sessions.
- Coordinator grouping remains unchanged.
- No UI regressions in session selection/attach.

title: TUI: Leader key footer with Zellij-style hints
description: Replace bottom status time with leader key hint; when leader active show available commands sorted by usefulness. Use Zellij-style Nerd font chevron glyphs + colored key.

title: Web UI: Move session filter into left panel
description:
Context: Session filter input is not co-located with the session tree, making discovery slower.
Scope:
- Move the filter text box into the left-hand session selection panel.
- Keep filter behavior unchanged.
- Ensure layout works on desktop and mobile.
Acceptance:
- Filter input appears in the session selection left panel.
- Filtering still affects the session tree as before.
- Mobile/desktop layouts remain usable.

title: TUI: Zellij-style bottom bar legend for leader commands
description:
Context: The TUI bottom bar needs a clearer, Zellij-style command legend. Scope: - Revamp the bottom bar to show only the leader key in normal mode. - When the leader key is pressed, replace the bar with the Zellij-style command legend (single-line, left-to-right segments with chevron separators, prefix `Ctrl +`, each segment formatted ` LABEL`). - Use the segment order and labels from the provided spec: LOCK,

PANE, TAB, RESIZE, MOVE, SEARCH, SESSION, QUIT. - Keep the bar informational (static text), not interactive widgets. Acceptance: - Normal mode bottom bar shows only the leader key hint. - After leader is pressed, the bar shows the Zellij-style legend with chevron separators and the specified segments. - Legend is one terminal row, spans full width, and does not change input handling beyond existing leader behavior.

title: CLI: implement vtr spoke (coordinator)
description: Implement new spoke command in cmd/vtr/spoke.go. Behavior: start local coordinator, serve gRPC on unix socket (default /var/run/vtrpc.sock) and optional TCP (default 127.0.0.1:4621). Accept --hub host:port for future federation; for now, validate reachability (dial + log) or store in logs without hard dependency. Use TLS+token when dialing hub if provided in config. Read defaults from vtrpc.toml (VTRPC_CONFIG_DIR). Do NOT edit cmd/vtr/root.go in this bead.

title: Web UI: Create new sessions
description:
Context: The web UI can list/attach sessions but cannot create new sessions directly.
Scope:
- Add a "new tab" button in the session tab bar to create a new session.
- Create sessions with a default name (no input required at creation time).
- Wire the UI to the coordinator API that creates sessions.
- Update the session list/tabs after creation and optionally auto-attach the new session.
Acceptance:
- User can create a session from the tab bar without leaving the page.
- New session is created with a default name (no input prompt).
- New session appears in tabs and session list immediately.
- Optional auto-attach behavior is defined and consistent.

title: M10 - Build System (mise)
description:
Goal: Standardize tool versions and task automation via mise.

Deliverables:
- mise.toml with Go/Zig/clang versions and tasks for shim/build/test/all
- Onboarding: mise trust/install/run all
- Docs align CGO toolchain env vars with tasks

Success criteria:
- mise run all builds shim and runs tests
- Tool versions match go.mod + shim build.zig.zon

Historical: completed; migrated from docs/progress.md.

title: Web UI: Desktop input UX (focus terminal, hide mobile controls)
description:
Context: App renders ActionTray and InputBar unconditionally in web/src/App.tsx; on desktop users expect direct key input to the terminal.
Scope:
- Only show ActionTray/InputBar on mobile-sized viewports.
- Auto-focus the terminal container on attach and allow direct key input without a text box.
- Keep touch-friendly controls on mobile.
Acceptance:
- Desktop view hides the action tray and command input bar.
- Terminal view receives focus and keyboard input directly on desktop.
- Mobile behavior remains unchanged.

title: TUI: Bind j/k for session navigation and x to kill
description:
Context: TUI session navigation/management keys need to be remapped to vim-style bindings for faster use.
Scope:
- Bind `j` to next session and `k` to previous session in the TUI.
- Bind `x` to kill the current session.
- Update any on-screen help/legend to reflect the new key bindings.
Acceptance:
- Pressing `j` moves to the next session; `k` moves to the previous session.
- Pressing `x` kills the current session (with existing confirmation behavior if any).
- Key hints in the status/legend match the new bindings.

title: Web UI: Auto-create sessions with default non-colliding names
description:
Context: New session creation should be a single-click action without any modal or naming prompt.
Scope:
- Create sessions automatically with a default non-colliding name.
- Remove any modal/prompt from the new-session flow.
- Ensure the new session appears immediately and optionally auto-attaches.
Acceptance:
- Creating a new session requires no modal or text input.
- Session names are generated to avoid collisions.
- New session appears in the UI immediately after creation.

title: Web UI: Use Tokyo Night default for terminal background
description:
Context: Terminal cell rendering in web/src/components/TerminalGrid.tsx maps bg=0 to #000000, so the grid appears pure black.
Scope:
- Treat the default background color as Tokyo Night (e.g. --tn-bg-alt or --tn-panel) instead of #000000.
- Preserve explicit ANSI colors when provided by the screen update.
Acceptance:
- Terminal background matches the Tokyo Night theme when the server does not set a custom bg color.
- ANSI-specified bg colors still render correctly.

title: Web UI DOM renderer width smaller than expected vs canvas
description: Observed in mise dev: DOM renderer shows narrower terminal width than expected; canvas renderer matches expected width. Likely CSS/measurement or cell sizing issue. Investigate DOM renderer sizing vs canvas path.
close_reason: Disabled ligatures/kerning in DOM terminal grid to keep monospace advances consistent with measured cell width.

title: Web UI: Browser-style session tabs with context actions
description:
Context: Web UI needs a browser-like tabbed session interface; tab styling should closely resemble Chrome.
Scope:
- Implement a tab bar where each session is represented as a tab, styled like Chrome (no gap between tab bar and content).
- Use active tab highlighting and Chrome-like tab shapes/spacing.
- Remove per-tab close buttons; rely on middle-click and context-menu close instead.
- Support middle-click to close a tab/session.
- Add a right-click context menu per tab with actions like close, send signals, and special/control characters.
- Keep existing session list behaviors compatible or define how tabs replace/augment them.
Acceptance:
- Each session appears as a Chrome-style tab; switching tabs changes the active session.
- There is no explicit close button on tabs; middle-click closes and context menu offers close.
- Tab bar is visually flush with content (no spacing gap).
- Right-clicking a tab opens a context menu with session-specific actions.
- Tab UI is responsive and usable on desktop and mobile (appropriate adaptations).

title: Web UI: Clip terminal row vertical overflow

title: Web UI: Query/filter sessions in multi-view dashboard
description:
Context: As the multi-view dashboard grows, users need to target subsets of sessions (e.g., "idle agents in foo") for inspection and later actions.
Scope:
- Add a query/filter bar to the multi-view dashboard.
- Define an initial filter grammar or UI filters for coordinator + status (e.g., idle/busy/exited) with room to expand.
- Filtering should update the visible thumbnails and the current selection set.
Acceptance:
- Query/filter input is available in multi-view mode.
- Users can filter by coordinator name and at least one session status (idle/busy/exited).
- Filtered results update the visible thumbnails and selection set without a reload.

title: TUI: Add h/l tab navigation bindings
description:
Context: TUI attach currently uses j/k (and n/p) to move between sessions via leader key. Add vim-style h/l bindings for previous/next tab navigation to match terminal UX expectations.

Scope:
- Add leader+h for previous tab/session and leader+l for next tab/session.
- Keep existing bindings (j/k, n/p) unchanged.
- Update any on-screen legend hints to include h/l where appropriate.

Acceptance:
- Ctrl+b then h switches to previous tab/session.
- Ctrl+b then l switches to next tab/session.
- Existing navigation bindings remain intact.
- Legends/help reflect the new bindings without regressions.

title: Web UI: Move terminal focus styling to shadow panel
description:
Context: The terminal surface :focus-visible outline is visually ugly; focus should be indicated on the surrounding shadow panel instead.
Scope:
- Remove/override the terminal surface focus-visible outline.
- Apply focus styling to the terminal container (shadow-panel) by changing its border color on focus.
- Ensure focus indication remains accessible and consistent across keyboard/mouse focus.
Acceptance:
- Terminal surface no longer shows a default outline/border on focus.
- Terminal container border changes color when the terminal is focused.
- Focus styling works for keyboard and mouse focus.

title: Federation: hub proxy for core RPCs (List/Info/Send/etc)
description: Implement hub-side federation per docs/federation-hub-spoke.md: load spoke list from vtrpc.toml, dial spokes over gRPC (TLS+token), and proxy core RPCs (List, Info, GetScreen, Grep, SendText/Key/Bytes, Resize, WaitFor/Idle). Merge session lists and expose spoke:session naming. Keep streaming (Subscribe) out of scope for this bead. Requires hub/spoke commands + auth in place.

title: Server: gRPC TCP listener + TLS/token auth
description: Add server-side support for gRPC over TCP with TLS + token auth. Files: server/grpc.go (or new server/listen.go, server/auth.go). Implement ServeTCP(ctx, coord, addr, tlsConfig, token) in addition to existing ServeUnix. Add unary/stream interceptors to enforce token when configured (Authorization: Bearer <token>). Require TLS when listening on non-loopback TCP. Local Unix sockets continue to use filesystem permissions only. Keep behavior aligned with docs/spec.md Authentication section. Avoid touching CLI files in this bead.

title: Web UI: Investigate and propose comprehensive menu system
description:
Context: Web UI lacks a comprehensive menu system for session actions and sending special control sequences/signals that may be blocked by the browser.
Scope:
- Review current web app structure and interaction flows for session actions.
- Investigate options for exposing advanced actions (create/kill, send control sequences like Ctrl-C/Ctrl-B, send signals like SIGKILL/SIGTERM).
- Propose a menu system UX and information architecture suitable for web constraints.
- Document findings and a recommended approach for human review.
Acceptance:
- A written proposal exists describing the menu system, placement, and interaction model.
- Proposal includes handling for control-sequence actions and signal sending, with browser limitations noted.
- Recommendations align with current app structure and are feasible to implement.

title: Web UI: Group tabs by coordinator and remove tab close button
description:
Context: The tab bar should present sessions grouped by coordinator without repeating coordinator names inside each tab, and tabs should rely on alternate close interactions.
Scope:
- Group session tabs by coordinator in the tab bar.
- Do not show coordinator name inside individual tabs.
- Remove any explicit close button from tabs.
- Preserve alternate close mechanisms (e.g., middle-click/context menu) if already planned.
Acceptance:
- Tabs are visually grouped by coordinator in the tab bar.
- Tab labels omit coordinator prefixes.
- Tabs have no explicit close button.
- Tab interactions remain functional and discoverable.

title: Web UI: Disable terminal text selection
description:
Context: Web terminal text can be selected, which interferes with input focus and feels unlike a terminal.
Scope:

- Ensure clicking the terminal focuses it without selecting text.
- Preserve selection behavior for non-terminal UI elements (menus, input fields).
Acceptance:
- Dragging/clicking inside the terminal does not highlight text.
- Click focuses the terminal for keyboard input.
- Other UI areas remain selectable where appropriate.

title: Memory safety docs

title: TUI: Clickable session tabs with middle-click kill
description:
Context: With mouse support, the TUI tab bar should be clickable for session switching and management.
Scope:
- Enable clicking a session tab to switch to that session.
- Support middle-click on a tab to kill the corresponding session (with existing confirmation if any).
- Keep keyboard navigation intact.
Acceptance:
- Left-clicking a tab activates that session.
- Middle-clicking a tab kills that session.
- No regressions to keyboard-driven tab/session navigation.

title: TUI: Add tab bar header with session names and coordinator label
description:
Context: The TUI needs a tab-style header for session navigation with a clean top bar.
Scope:
- Add a top tab bar that lists each session name as a tab.
- Display session names without the coordinator prefix.
- Reserve the top bar for tabs only (no coordinator label).
- Show the coordinator name in the bottom-left corner of the status bar instead.
- Highlight the active session tab and keep existing navigation behavior.
Acceptance:
- Top header shows only tabs for each session with names stripped of coordinator prefix.
- Active session is visually indicated in the tab bar.
- Coordinator name appears in the bottom-left status area.
- No regressions to session switching or layout.

title: Coordinator tree + search + attach flow
description:
Build coordinator tree view with search/filter and session attach UX.

- Expand/collapse coordinators with status chips.
- Search matches coordinator/session names.
- Attach flow with clear connect/reconnect states.

title: Web UI: Dev mode HMR via Vite when running vtr web
description:
Context: vtr web serves embedded web/dist assets only; local changes in web/ do not hot-reload.
Scope:
- Add a dev-mode path for vtr web to proxy to, or launch, the Vite dev server (HMR) when running locally.
- Keep production behavior serving embedded web/dist unchanged.

title: Headless mode: coordinator must answer CPR/DSR
description:
Problem: In headless mode with no terminal emulator attached, TUIs (e.g., Codex) send DSR/CPR queries like CSI 6n and block or error when no response arrives. A PTY is just a byte stream and does not synthesize replies, so without a client acting as a terminal emulator, the queries go unanswered. This breaks the intended architecture where clients are optional passive viewers and the coordinator is the primary VT engine.

Planned solution: Have the coordinator/VT engine treat DSR/CPR as a terminal-emulator responsibility. Detect CPR/DSR escape sequences in the output processing path and synthesize replies using the real cursor state from the VT engine (1-indexed row/col). Write the reply back into the PTY input stream for that session. This should happen regardless of attached clients so headless mode is fully functional. Initially support CSI 6n (cursor position report) and optionally DEC variant CSI ? 6 n; consider adding CSI 5n (status report) and DA/DA2 (CSI c / CSI ? c) if needed later.

title: Coordinator: Detect idle sessions and broadcast over gRPC
description:
Context: There is no centralized idle detection, so UIs cannot distinguish active vs idle sessions at a glance.
Scope:
- Track per-session activity centrally (screen updates and/or input events) and compute idle state with debounce/hysteresis.
- Add idle status to coordinator state and broadcast changes over gRPC (e.g., new Subscribe event or field) with session identifiers.
- Document idle threshold and update tests for state transitions and debounce behavior.
Acceptance:
- Idle state flips only after the configured inactivity threshold and does not thrash on brief pauses.
- gRPC subscribers receive idle-state change events with session ID/name and current state.
- Existing streaming behavior remains intact; tests cover idle transition + debounce.
